sources.title: Belorussian Station
sources.description:
The film's heroes parted ways at Belorussky Station in the summer of 1945, when the first train carrying front-line soldiers arrived after the victory. A quarter century after the end of the Great Patriotic War, the comrades meet at their friend's funeral. Peacetime had separated them, but the friends retained a sense of frontline brotherhood, mutual assistance, and humanity.

IMDb: 7,7

Year of production: 1970

Director: Andrey Smirnov
Screenwriter: Vadim Trunin
Composers: Bulat Okudzhava, Alfred Schnittke
DOP: Pavel Lebeshev
Production Designer: Vladimir Korovin

Cast: Alexey Glazyrin, Yevgeny Leonov, Anatoly Papanov, Vsevolod Safonov, Nina Urgant, Nikolay Volkov Jr., Nikifor Kolofidin, Raisa Kurkina, Yuri Orlov, Lyubov Sokolova, Margarita Terekhova, Aleksandr Yanvarev
